siteMetadata.name: Talha Enes Ayranci
siteMetadata.title: Talha Enes Ayranci
siteMetadata.description: PhD Candidate in Computer Science at the University of Glasgow.
siteMetadata.about:
I am a second-year PhD student in Computing Science at the University of Glasgow, under the supervision of Dr. Jonathan Grizou and Dr. Mireilla Bikanga Ada. My research focuses on educational robotics.
            
Apart from research, I like writing blogs, watching and playing football and exploring the beautiful places of Scotland. I also have a beginner's level interest in the philosophy of science.
siteMetadata.author: talhayranci

markdownRemark.html:
The Joystick project is based on the principle of maneuvering Curio using a smartphone or any device with a browser and Bluetooth capability (except iOS devices ðŸ˜¬, but don't worry Curio Host is the solution). It's actually nothing more than a joystick for you but it's the beginning of everything for Curio.


Click this link to use the joystick. Here how you can connect it:


The project is written in ReactJS with Typescript. If you want to see the source codes, just check the project repo here. The project codes might feel you a bit confused since it also includes the iOS integration. Feel free to explore!
